text: (upbeat music)
- I'm Melonia Mendonca, I have been in AWS
for around five and a half years.

I am currently an
engineering manager here,
in the service called AWS Systems Manager.
(upbeat music)

I joined Amazon as an
entry level engineer,

and I was given a lot of
good opportunities to grow,

and became and grew up
to be a senior engineer,
and then moved,

I just recently moved to a
management role last year.
I think coming into Amazon,
I knew that in about five, six years,
I wanted to move to a management role
and I had let my managers know about that.
And so I was given the right opportunities

to actually build my soft
skills over the years.

I think I feel most energized
and motivated by the fact

that I can mentor people
into growing and being
the best versions of themselves.

When I see someone who is
struggling at something
and then suddenly makes a big breakthrough
in that same area,

I kind of feel the joy
that they're feeling.
And that was one of the main reasons

why I wanted to move
into a management role.
(upbeat music)

I know that there is a lot
of like talk outside of AWS

about how it's very difficult
and things like that.
I think that if being challenged regularly

is something that motivates
you, learning something new,
learning cutting edge technology
is what you are looking for,
then AWS is definitely the place for you.
(upbeat music)
